column4: are there any ndiswrapper success stores around here?  i can't seem to get networkmanager to recognize that ndiswrapper's module is loaded
worked great for me when I used the windows 2000 driver
does lsusb see it in a terminal?
says "no firmware" next to it though...
do you have a wired connection so you can get the firmware?
ok im getting ndis write errors in my dmesg
thats probably the issue then ... are you doing them as sudo?
yes i always use ndiswrapper as sudo
does my user have to be part of a certain group?
just sudo or admin, can you do sudo apt-get update and have it work?
why would that work if the computer doesn't have internet
plus whenever i do modprobe it (with sudo of course) i get that "All config files need .conf" message
forgot you dont have a wired connection right now ... ok, try gksudo gedit /etc/fstab and see if it opens
